intro: Endiandra aurea, commonly known as the golden endiandra, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, reddish-brown bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, followed by dark blue, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
